sentences.sContent: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.sCn: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.sContent: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.sCn: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.sContent: ...Penny-pinching UK consumers choose cheaper products from discounters such as Aldi and Lidl rather than luxury alternatives...
...They are also spending more time working with each other rather than reporting upwards...
...organisations increasingly use “team” as a verb rather than a noun: they form teams for specific purposes and then quickly disband them...
...most of the people had said they’d rather cut down gradually before quitting...
...Research suggests they may study more broadly for the unexpected rather than search for answers...
...it is wise for the parents to set an example rather than make demands...
...So it may seem rather strange that I have returned to college to finish the degree I left undone some four decades ago...
...points out that reporting is about investigation rather than the memorization of minute details...
...but rather that it failed to execute on a strategy to confront it...

trans.tranOther: You use rather to indicate that something is true to a fairly great extent, especially when you are talking about something unpleasant or undesirable
